head.title: Stake Is Raised In Crazy Eddie

hedline.hl1: Stake Is Raised In Crazy Eddie

body.head.byline: Special to the New York Times

block.p: LEAD: An investment group consisting of Entertainment Marketing Inc. and Oppenheimer-Palmieri Fund L.P., disclosed that it had raised its stake in Crazy Eddie Inc. to 15.6 percent, from 14.6 percent.

An investment group consisting of Entertainment Marketing Inc. and Oppenheimer-Palmieri Fund L.P., disclosed that it had raised its stake in Crazy Eddie Inc. to 15.6 percent, from 14.6 percent.

In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Elias Zinn, the chairman of Entertainment Marketing, based in Houston, said he had purchased an additional 320,000 Crazy Eddie shares on the open market at prices of $4.75 to $4.91 a share. Mr. Zinn gave no details in the S.E.C. filing about the group's preparations for a proxy fight to gain control of the Crazy Eddie board. A meeting of the shareholders of the retail electronics chain, which is based in Edison, N.J., is scheduled for Nov. 6.
